column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Before trying Jinya
column2: I thought Tiger Den was my favorite spot to get ramen. I came here on a Thursday during late lunch time
column3: and it was pretty dead. Immediately got seated. I feel like they could've done better with designing the layout
column4: because I can totally see how it would get annoying during rush hours. Aside from that
column5: the ramen was d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s. I normally get spicy miso ramen because the prior times of trying regular tonkatsu ramen at other places
column6: I thought it was very bland. However
column7: the tonkatsu black at Jinya was made to perfection. The noodles were thin
column8: and the soup was creamy - but not too overly creamy. The pork belly was so tender and juicy.
